Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2010 07:07PM MW943 wrote: Hi there, I was diagnosed in early December of last year. After I went through the phases of shock, anger, grief, acceptance...I dived into research to understand what I was dealing with. Having some idea of what I was facing gave me some sort of control.  There's a lot of good advice and information here.  In my case, ILC tends to be sneaky and harder to detect (compared to IDC). I opted to have the bilateral mastectomy.  I'm those people who like to take control of things so it was a easy decision for me.  While my surgeon didn't influence me one way or the other, she was relieved that I chose the bilateral mastectomy.  It turned out that they found some evidence of "mild ductal hyperplasia" in the other breast during the surgery so I was glad I did what I did. Hang in there!  I promise you things will get better. The ladies here are great.  They supported me during the most difficult time.  Take care.  Marie
